intro: Bidens degeneri var. apioides, commonly known as the yellow oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features showy yellow flowers with a central disk of dark brown or black tubular florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies adds ecological value to the landscape.
